name: Vriesea ospinae
description: Vriesea ospinae is an epiphytic bromeliad native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Colombia and Ecuador. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and features upright rosettes (30-60 cm tall) with large, dramatic, lance-shaped, dark green leaves with distinctive patterns and central water-holding cups. The plant displays an upright rosette growth habit. Many bromeliads form central water-holding rosettes that create mini ecosystems. Adapted to tropical climates with high humidity, consistent warmth, and filtered light conditions. In its native habitat, it grows on tree branches in tropical forests. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant adds vibrant colors and visual interest to any environment. It's popular among bromeliad enthusiasts for its attractive foliage.
careTips: Keep central cup (vase) filled with water
Water soil sparingly - mainly keep cup filled
Remove dead leaves to maintain appearance
